title: Johnson sorry for offence caused by party joke video
content: The PM says he was given assurances no party had taken place - but Labour says he is taking people for fools.

title: Johnson sorry for offence caused by party joke video
content: The PM says he was given assurances no party had taken place - but Labour says he is taking people for fools.

title: What next for Johnson after the No 10 party video?
content: Footage of No 10 staff joking about a lockdown party has left even the PM's supporters stunned.

title: MPs earn up to £350 an hour for taking surveys
content: Over 120 politicians did work for polling companies, earning more than £116,000 since the last election.

title: What were the rules on Christmas parties?
content: Any party at Downing Street would have breached the government's guidelines at the time.

title: Politics was priority amid Afghan exit - official
content: A Foreign Office official tells the BBC the government's handling of the evacuation was "unforgiveable".

title: UK official regrets holiday during Afghan crisis
content: Sir Philip Barton says he has "reflected on" his 17-day summer holiday and would not do the same again.

title: MP claims cover-up over evacuated Afghan animals
content: Boris Johnson denies intervening to get charity staff and pets out of Afghanistan in the summer.
